tool.name: ImportActiveDirectoryConfiguration
tool.summary:
This tool provides a GP interface to the "Import Active Directory Configuration" functionality provided by the Workflow Manager Administrator. In short, it allows you to import the user and group lists and associations from Active Directory to the Workflow Manager database.

In contrast to the COTS tool, the credentials for the user who is running the tool are used to access the domain and AD; it is not possible to specify an alternate user or domain as an argument. (This would need to be done at the OS level before the tool is run.)

NOTE: While Workflow Manager privileges and database administrative access is not modified for existing groups or users, respectively, these items will not be set for any new groups or users. If you anticipate calling the "Import Active Directory Configuration" GP tool on a regular basis, you may wish to combine it with the "Modify Administrator Access" and/or the "Modify Privilege Assignment" tools to account for these potential issues.
tool.usage:
• The default Workflow Manager database must be set before running this tool.

  • The user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_string_groupOfUsers
param.displayname: AD group containing the full list of Workflow Manager users
param.dialogReference:
The name of an Active Directory group that contains the full list of users to be entered into the Workflow Manager database. As much as it's possible, each user's AD info will be used to populate their info in the Workflow Manager database (e-mail address, etc.).

Please note that the AD group and the user running this tool must be members of the same domain. The user must also have any AD permissions needed to access/view the group.
param.pythonReference:
The name of an Active Directory group that contains the full list of users to be entered into the Workflow Manager database. As much as it's possible, each user's AD info will be used to populate their info in the Workflow Manager database (e-mail address, etc.).

Please note that the AD group and the user running this tool must be members of the same domain. The user must also have any AD permissions needed to access/view the group.

param.name: in_string_groupofGroups
param.displayname: AD group containing the full list of Workflow Manager groups (which themselves contain user assignments)
param.dialogReference:
The name of an Active Directory group that contains the full list of groups to be entered into the Workflow Manager database. Each group listed must itself be an AD group. The users contained by these secondary groups will be added to the equivalent groups once they have been brought into the Workflow Manager database.

Please note that the AD group and the user running this tool must be members of the same domain. The user must also have any AD permissions needed to access/view the groups.
param.pythonReference:
The name of an Active Directory group that contains the full list of groups to be entered into the Workflow Manager database. Each group listed must itself be an AD group. The users contained by these secondary groups will be added to the equivalent groups once they have been brought into the Workflow Manager database.

Please note that the AD group and the user running this tool must be members of the same domain. The user must also have any AD permissions needed to access/view the groups.

param.name: in_bool_preserveCurrentUser
param.displayname: Preserve the executing user's login in the database (even if it's removed from the AD)
param.dialogReference:
In order to modify users and groups, the user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database. However, there is no guarantee that this user will be a member of the AD user group passed into the tool. If he/she is not, the user's login will be removed from the Workflow Manager DB which could lead to maintenance problems.

Enabling this option will override this behavior and preserve the current user's entry in the database even if it is not listed in the AD group.

When calling this tool from a script, the possible values for this parameter are:

  • PRESERVE / true - Ensure's that the current user's login is still present in the Workflow Manager database after the tool is run.

  • NO_PRESERVE / false - Allow the "Import..." tool to function with no restrictions, including the removal of the current user from the Workflow Manager database.
param.pythonReference:
In order to modify users and groups, the user running this tool must have administrative access to the Workflow Manager database. However, there is no guarantee that this user will be a member of the AD user group passed into the tool. If he/she is not, the user's login will be removed from the Workflow Manager DB which could lead to maintenance problems.

Enabling this option will override this behavior and preserve the current user's entry in the database even if it is not listed in the AD group.

When calling this tool from a script, the possible values for this parameter are:

  • PRESERVE / true - Ensure's that the current user's login is still present in the Workflow Manager database after the tool is run.

  • NO_PRESERVE / false - Allow the "Import..." tool to function with no restrictions, including the removal of the current user from the Workflow Manager database.

param.name: in_string_wmxDatabaseAlias
param.dialogReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.
param.pythonReference: An optional parameter specifying that this tool should run on some database other than the default Workflow Manager database. If left blank, the default Workflow Manager database will be used.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This tool provides a GP interface to the "Import Active Directory Configuration" functionality provided by the Workflow Manager Administrator. In short, it allows you to import the user and group lists and associations from Active Directory to the Workflow Manager database.

In contrast to the COTS tool, the credentials for the user who is running the tool are used to access the domain and AD; it is not possible to specify an alternate user or domain as an argument. (This would need to be done at the OS level before the tool is run.)

NOTE: While Workflow Manager privileges and database administrative access is not modified for existing groups or users, respectively, these items will not be set for any new groups or users. If you anticipate calling the "Import Active Directory Configuration" GP tool on a regular basis, you may wish to combine it with the "Modify Administrator Access" and/or the "Modify Privilege Assignment" tools to account for these potential issues.
